Definition: Your task is to localize given English phrase into Telugu language. When localising, follow these rules - (1) General names and concepts can be translated (2) Domain specific names can just be transliterated (3) Localised phrases can have both partial translated and transliterated parts (4) But only partial translation or only partial transliteration is not allowed (5) Copy special characters and numbers as is

Positive Examples.explanation: The sentence is truly translated as all the words are generic
The sentence is transliterated as is because the words are domain specific
The first part of the sentence is translated into Telugu as it is generic and the second part is transliterated as it is domain specific. Also, special characters are copied as is.

Negative Examples.explanation: The sentence is generic enough to translate word 'browser' instead of transliteration
The localization is wrong as the sentence is only partially translated and there is no transliteration part in it

Negative Examples.input: Display the contents of folders (User's home folder as default)
Negative Examples.explanation: The localization is wrong as part of the sentence present in brackets is not correctly translated or transliterated
